intro: Leptactina congolana, commonly known as the Congo thistle, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Leptactina congolana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
